Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Creepy \Creep"y\ (kr[=e]p"[y^]), a. Crawly; having or producing a sensation like that caused by insects creeping on the skin. [Colloq.] [1913 Webster]
One's whole blood grew curdling and creepy. --R. Browning. [1913 Webster]

creepy adj 1: annoying and unpleasant; "some creepy kids were bothering her" 2: causing a sensation as of things crawling on your skin; "a creepy story"; "I had a creepy-crawly feeling" [syn: {creepy-crawly}] [also: {creepiest}, {creepier}]
